function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The pandemic outbreak creates economic crisis and major social implications, leading to potential health risks and impacts on the built environment.","Impact":"Health risks and impacts on the built environment may persist if not mitigated, leading to further spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to address economic crisis and social implications, prioritize public health, and adopt sustainable development practices.","Technologies":"Public health technologies, sustainable building technologies, and economic development strategies.","People":"General public, stakeholders in the built environment, and individuals at risk of contagious diseases.","Owner":"Governments, public health organizations, urban planners, and stakeholders in the built environment."},{"Description":"The search for resilience in response to infectious diseases must also ensure a more sustainable built environment with a positive balance between health and social, economic, and environmental aspects.","Impact":"Failure to achieve a sustainable and resilient built environment may lead to ongoing risks and vulnerabilities to contagious diseases and other related challenges.","Mitigation":"Promote sustainable development practices, integrate health considerations into urban planning, and prioritize environmental sustainability.","Technologies":"Sustainable building materials, urban planning technologies, and health monitoring technologies.","People":"Urban planners, environmental advocates, public health officials, and residents of urban areas.","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, environmental organizations, and public health agencies."},{"Description":"Structural leverage and disruptive change are needed to achieve a sustainable built environment that addresses the risks associated with infectious diseases and other environmental challenges.","Impact":"Lack of structural leverage and disruptive change may result in continued vulnerability to infectious diseases and other environmental risks within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Implement innovative technologies, adopt sustainable building practices, and promote community resilience to infectious diseases.","Technologies":"Smart building technologies, sustainable construction materials, and community health monitoring systems.","People":"Building developers, technology innovators, community leaders, and residents of built environments.","Owner":"Building developers, technology firms, community organizations, and local government agencies."}]}
